TopicDetails.supportInfo:
For help related to this call, please contact HOME-AMIF-UNION-ACTIONS@ec.europa.eu

Funding & Tenders Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

IT Helpdesk – Contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Online Manual – Step-by-step online guide through the Portal processes from proposal preparation and evaluation to reporting on your ongoing project. Valid for all 2021-2027 programmes.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action and the type of model grant agreement that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice, as it cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

latestInfos.content:
The European Commission, Directorate-General Migration and Home Affairs has published an updated version for the Call for proposals Transnational Actions on Asylum, Migration and Integration (AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL).

Detailed information about the changes introduced and the respective pages can be found in the Call document, “History of changes” (Page 2). 

Please note that these changes do not affect the deadline for submitting proposals under this call.

Information session Call for proposals Transnational Actions on Asylum, Migration and Integration (AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL)

The European Commission, Directorate-General Migration and Home Affairs will organise on 15 February 2023 at 9.30 an online information session on the Call for proposals Transnational Actions on Asylum, Migration and Integration (AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL).

 The event will take place via Webex, will last for approximately 2.5 hours and will give more information about both thematic priorities as well as the legal and administrative aspects relevant for the application process. The agenda is as follows:

 ·   09.30-09.45 - Welcome and introductory information

·   09.45-10.15 - Legal, financial and administrative aspects

·   10.15-10.30 – Topic 1-  Promoting community sponsorship schemes and integration of persons in need of protection

·   10.30-10.45 –Topic 2 - Integration and inclusion at regional and local level

·   10.45-11.00 – Break

·   11.00-11.15 –Topic 3 - Support to integration in education of migrant children and young adults

·   11.15-11.30 –Topic 4 - Multi-stakeholder initiatives for migrant integration into the labour market

·   11.30-11.45 – Topic 5 - Promoting complementary pathways linked to work

·   11.45-12.00 – Topic 6- Transnational actions to support Member States in the field of protection of children in migration

 The call for proposals is open until 16 May 2023 and all the eligibility criteria can be found in the call document and the Funding and Tender Opportunities Portal.

 During this info session, no questions and answers is foreseen. All questions can be sent to the functional mailbox at HOME-AMIF-UNION-ACTIONS@ec.europa.eu or via the chat during the event. The answers will be posted later on the Funding and Tenders Opportunities Portal along with the recording of the session.

You can join the meeting via the following link: 

https://ecconf.webex.com/ecconf/j.php?MTID=m73c2009dab004d69d2128a61a84e661c

 

Join by meeting number

Meeting number (access code): 2744 482 1591

 Meeting password: YwYf5NXY@73 (99935699 from phones)

  For more information please contact: HOME-AMIF-UNION-ACTIONS@ec.europa.eu

The submission session is now available for: AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-04-LABOUR(AMIF-PJG), AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-01-SPONSORSHIP(AMIF-PJG), AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-05-PATHWAYS(AMIF-PJG), AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-02-LOCAL(AMIF-PJG), AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-03-EDUCATION(AMIF-PJG), AMIF-2023-TF2-AG-CALL-06-CHILDREN(AMIF-PJG)
